Click the link in the box to the right to view the complete Op-Ed article.<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td>(March 3, 2016) The recent unfortunate incident in our town has created speculation about ways to keep our children out of trouble.&nbsp; The case of Tina Tully (also known as Tiny) remains fresh in the minds of all residents.&nbsp; Tina Tully, eight years old, was recently accused of a series of thefts of musical instruments.&nbsp; When local police eventually caught Tina in the act, she confessed, explaining that she was only &ldquo;borrowing&rdquo; one instrument at a time.&nbsp; It happens that she longed to play an instrument, but was not sure which one to choose.&nbsp; So, during a period of several days she sampled a number of musical possibilities, somehow avoiding detection by the staff. She eventually settled on the tuba.&nbsp; When questioned, Tina expressed sadness that her three older brothers had been given access to music lessons while in the local schools.&nbsp; Budget cuts forced the elimination of music programs, so Tina took matters into her own hands.&nbsp; What&rsquo;s a music store owner and police chief to do?&nbsp; That&rsquo;s easy: Tina was forgiven and will perform community service at Tooters weekly for the next three months.&nbsp; Best of all, the store has donated a tuba rental and music lessons to Tina.&nbsp; Happy ending? optional, free lessons on an instrument of their choice; affordable rentals with an option to buy the instrument; and joining the chorus, a performance orchestra, the marching band, or small, select instrumental groups.&nbsp;&nbsp; Students also could receive counseling and advice offered by music professionals at all schools in our city.&nbsp; Few people are aware that when it was decided to cut a program, the choice was either drama or music.&nbsp; The meaning of the introductory statement in bold type is a little unclear:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Time on learning&mdash;deciding what&rsquo;s important.</strong>&nbsp; What about those students who thirst for music?&nbsp; As John Lennon said, &ldquo;Music is everybody&rsquo;s possession.&rdquo;&nbsp; Let&rsquo;s return to sharing that valuable possession.&nbsp; Reinstatement of music programs in our city will bring countless benefits to the children in our community.</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Read the rest of the paragraph to decide what the introductory statement means.&nbsp; What is the main idea of this paragraph?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_c4bdc2ba-c9a6-ae5f-a3a7-fb6068cb36f6\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_c4bd...</strong></jumc></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>After you have identified the main idea for the third paragraph, you can use questioning to identify additional details.&nbsp;<br /><br />Read the paragraph and ask yourself, <em>What is the result of the decision to focus on important subjects?</em><br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Time on learning&mdash;deciding what&rsquo;s important.</strong>&nbsp; All these programs have been cut or reduced due to policies that demand more time and focus on academic areas.&nbsp; Students have six hours in a school day, and those in control of those six hours have dictated that academics rule.&nbsp; What about those students who thirst for music?&nbsp; As John Lennon said, &ldquo;Music is everybody&rsquo;s possession.&rdquo;&nbsp; Let&rsquo;s return to sharing that valuable possession.&nbsp; Reinstatement of music programs in our city will bring countless benefits to the children in our community.</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Select ALL of the details from the paragraph that answer this question and provide support for the main idea. You will select TWO correct responses.</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_2a6a5a2f-906b-ef54-4d5d-9f7f86849dbc\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_2a6a...</strong></jumc></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>This is what you have learned about the third paragraph:<br /><br /><strong>Main idea</strong></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\">A decision was made that time spent on learning is better spent on academics than music.</p><p><strong>Additional details that support the main idea</strong></p><ul><li>Music programs have been cut</li><li>The focus is on academic areas<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>In the next paragraph from the Op-Ed, the introductory statement identifies the paragraph&#39;s main idea more clearly:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Participation in an instrumental music program keeps kids busy and committed.</strong>&nbsp; A well-run band program requires a time commitment of its participants.&nbsp; Students need time to take lessons, practice, perform, and compete.&nbsp; All these time commitments keep our youth busy and out of trouble.&nbsp; In the words of <em>The Music</em> <em>Man, </em>&ldquo;Idle hands are the devil&rsquo;s workshop.&rdquo;&nbsp; Kids with nothing to do are more likely to engage in negative behaviors than those who fill their after-school hours with music.</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>To find the details in the paragraph, ask yourself, <em>How does being busy help kids?</em><br /><br />The details in the paragraph help answer your question.<br /><br />Which TWO details does the paragraph include?<br /><br /><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_80251fb4-f8a2-2fd3-9c6c-49af8fa3ee02\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_8025...</strong></jumc></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>This is what you have learned about the fourth paragraph:<br /><br /><strong>Main idea</strong></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\">Music keeps kids busy.</p><p><strong>Additional details that support the main idea</strong></p><ul><li>Participating in a music program involves a time commitment.</li><li>When kids are busy, they stay out of trouble.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Identifying the author&#39;s organization of <strong>support</strong> and <strong>details</strong> helps you understand and remember what you are reading.&nbsp; Some readers like to make an <strong>outline</strong> to organize main ideas and details.<br /><br />Here is the fifth paragraph from the Op-Ed:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Making music is a team effort.</strong>&nbsp; Some community members have suggested that sports and music are in competition in our community.&nbsp; They suggest that sports promote a team spirit and mentality.&nbsp; Music makers also participate in a team.&nbsp; A single musician discovers new possibilities when he or she joins an orchestra, band, or chorus, lending a solitary tune to a group production and creating a whole that is bigger than the sum of its parts.</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Organizing ideas in an outline"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>When you use an outline to organize the main idea and details, you show the main idea as the (A) heading, and the details indented in a numbered list underneath<strong>:</strong><br /><br />A.
